item.title: Feed back suggestions quality of life improvement
item.description:
Wast sure what to put in tag but nevertheless

So I've started takeing more of a notice of my standing in focus but I must admit switching lenses is getting annoying when switching no reliable free way of getting them with out paying for the them to my knowledge mabey someone else can enlighten me on that so for me currently its basically a plat pit to throw away 80 plat a time so a suggestion would be to have a configuration A,B just 2 so DE don't lose on takeing plat form everyone at some point but this would be very grateful and useful to the players no sure why I'm asking tho lol doubt they will even read it and give it any thought but worth a try ðŸ¤£

item.title: Xaku Prex Lacks the Warframe's Name and Number
item.description:
All previous Prex cards of Warframes have their name and number (ordered by release date) in the border of the card, but Xaku's card, newly brought by Baro Ki'Teer, has neither.

Side note, does this imply that we won't be getting a Leverian for Xaku? If that's the case it'd be a shame. Given that Xaku is a fusion of three lost frames, their backstory has a lot of potential.

item.title: Asymmetrical Armor Pieces
item.description: As much as I can appreciate the idea DE has going in terms of armor pieces, having so many pieces be different depending on whether you place it on the left or right leg/shoulder is a bit irritating, I'd prefer being able to pick whether I can have both be the same piece, or if I want them to be asymmetrical, in the rare cases where I think it looks good. In addition, being able to choose which side has which armor piece would be appreciated.

item.title: I will do anything for the glorious Mirror Toggle. Anything... Please DE I beg of You. Shoulder Pads QoL [Suggestion]
item.description:
Mulciber Set is hands down the best we got in a couple of years. It got me excited about Baro
again and it was worth every Ducat. And dont get me wrong, Im loving it. But given how many single piece
Shoulder Pads we have I think we could use Mirror Toggle as in:

- If you have a Shoulder Piece you can toggle to have it in both Shoulders.
- Single Shoulder give only 1 more "Look" (Mirrored) in both Right and Left.
- Double Shoulders (like Mulciber) would actually make them more valuable as they would give
2 New "Looks" Right Mirrored, and Left Mirrored.

This would make ALL Shoulder Pads more valuable across the board. Elevating the Worth of pretty much
half of the Armor Sets available in the game. Win win.

item.title: Walking animations
item.description: Wouldn't it be great that female warframes had their own unique walking animations? For example, Wisp has a walking animation which suits her very well. But there are some warframes such as Mag, Trinity, Mirage, Nova and Nyx and more whose walking animations do not suit them well. They look masculine when they walk. In my opinion, Female warframes could have a feminine walking animation, thus, they could appeal to the eye. Is it applicable in the game?

item.title: Smeeta Kavat - Charm Icons need diversity
item.description:
Right now the Smeeta Kavat has six different abilities but they all use the same symbol.

The name is shown when the buff is applied but I would like to present some alternative symbols that could better show what each buff is doing in case you have missed the description text.

  • Critical Chance Buff
  • Resources and Affinity x2 Buff
  • Shielding Buff
  • Instant Reload Buff
  • Ablities are free Buff
  • Generate Rare Resource (does not need one since its instant)

I hope you like this idea.

item.title: Dera Vandal; muzzle flash is outdated
item.description:
This might also apply to the normal Dera, but I do not have one of those made to test with. I am hoping the Dera and Vandal variants, among many others will be shown love with the upcoming weapon rebalance, as I was going through some guns I haven't touched nearly enough for a while, I found that the Dera Vandal's muzzle flash is a little....dated.

These flashes are flat, static images that rotate to meet the camera on the horizontal axis. Not exactly up to date with the particle effects we've had for a while now.

item.title: QOL proposal: prime markers
item.description:
Baro Ki'teer just arrived, and I was having some trouble going back and forth between warframe market and the game, deciding what to give for ducats, what to sell for plat and what to keep for later use, and I had this idea, prime markers.

You could apply them to the item by middle clicking, a small menu could open with all the personalisation options, this could also work for materials, like marking what you need to farm, but I think the main use would be marking prime parts bc there are a lot of them.

I made 4 variants for this:

  • shapes and colours, which isn't so appealing (keep in mind I made this in paint tho) but gives you a lot of personalisation possibilities (and works well if you are daltonic too)
  • just shapes, simple
  • coloured squares, looks cleaner
  • coloured edges, looks the best imo

item.title: Steam Achievements not unlocked retroactively
item.description:
Hi, today by accident (to my completionist's despair), I discovered while you can run the Warframe Launcher as a standalone (without the need to have Steam platform running) that when you acquire a new achievement that is not related to playtime (in this example "Alchemist" for transmuting mods 10 times), it doesn't unlock itself retroactively in the Steam achievements for Warframe when playing the game after launching it though Steam platform (even though I transmuted few times after that).

Unless I may not have triggered the event to recheck the requirement for the said achievement (if so please share how), please look into this matter.

Also, would the remainder of the achievements have similar issues? i.e. quest, plains, and planet clear achievements.

Thank you

item.description: Ä° dont have much edited skill but i did this maybe DE came out that idea It can really excite the players. This conversation can pass between us. "It was very close, man." haha ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜…

item.title: Eidolon Teralyst/Gantulyst/Hydrolist Health Bar like other bosses
item.description:
Hello, I have a very small request. First of all, I love games like dark souls and I love boss fights. I really love the health bar you brought to bosses. We can do the same for the Eidolon.
Like the example in the photo. If you don't want this Health bar to seen out every night. It can appear when we get close to the boss or when charged lure connected.

item.title: Highlighting / marking unowned items in relics
item.description:
Hi.

So i have this problem with tracking items from relics that i do not own yet. And i have this suggestion to make: a some type of a highlight (like a contour) around a relic with an unowned item/blueprint would speed up looking for missing items. Additionally, a contour around the missing item after a relic is highlighted.

**Forma blueprints would perheps be best ignored**

Current: https://imgur.com/7mokHYn
Relic highlight: https://imgur.com/FDsWx7E

Current_in_relic: https://imgur.com/nuFbOOX
In_relic highlight: https://imgur.com/MPFOy93

item.title: Rainbow Energy?
item.description:
I think we really need an option to set flowing/shifting colors for our energy colors. This would allow certain abilities to pulse, like MPrime shifting between white and black or blue and white or something else for "cool" factor, but would also make various weapons obscenely more fun.

Ever since I built the supra, I thought to myself "How amazing would it be to have a shifting energy color? One that just moves around the color wheel, changing every half second to second, allowing me to spew forth a myriad of color and death, giving me a dubstep gun via warframe.

Really it's just for the cool/fun factor, there's no real need for this, but I'd love to see it implemented. As with the first example, it could be used to show shifting colors in abilities, or for pure hilarity. The sky's the limit and the player is zephyr ;)

item.title: Mag Deluxe chest sash clips to much.
item.description: The sash that hangs on the front of the chest clips to much into the lower chest/tummy when using most of the other animations and clips slightly with mags noble animation. I love the deluxe skin but i feel so limited in looks cause of animations i can't use.

item.title: Ugly, dirty and weathered textures
item.description:
I wanted to play the original Ash to discover the horror of what I saw.

Spoiler

Before and after

Spoiler

Why DE? Why would you do this to Ash? He literally looks like a action figure that has been put on the self and left there for years, he already got nerfed and this is just a slap to the face shown how bad the nerf was and that some ppl don`t used him anymore also he is one of the lest used warframes in 2018 even with the so called qol he got back in February. The colours look saturated and black on him makes it look grey. STOP FIXING THINK THAN AREN`T BROKEN! changes him back to the way he looked before this is not necessary! on top of that you made the hidden blades from bs change colour depending on the colour of Ash, I have a purple Ash, I don`t want by hidden blades to be purple, put it back the way it was.

Nova and Ember also have this.

Spoiler

Spoiler

The obvious solution is to make a customisation slot where you can pick the texture/material you want your warframe to look from dirty to metallic finish.

Please show support by liking this post and getting DE to change this back.

item.title: An option to stop the mouse cursor jumping around
item.description: Could there be an option to stop the mouse cursor jumping about whenever there is a value or text dialogue box? I would rather the cursor just stay exactly where I left it.

item.title: Operator school animation sets do nothing in missions, making them feel lifeless
item.description:
The title sums it up but to elaborate, Operators need some help. They aren't the main focus of gameplay and in a game called Warframe that's 100% fine and obvious, but as the main character of the story, the true player character, and an implied stand in for the player behind the screen, they feel very robotic and their (lack of) animations seem to me to be the cause of that. It's not that they don't have any at all- they do, and those are all very nice and expressive in relays, caputra, and the Orbiter- it's that they have zero effect on the Operator during actual missions.

To elaborate, here is the animation selection menu: https://i.imgur.com/el5KMEc.mp4

Here is the Vazarin idle, demonstrated in Caputra: https://i.imgur.com/8LANyqy.mp4

If these were indicative of how the Operators looked in mission, it would be entirely fine. They are not. Even putting aside the fact that none of them play in actual missions, the player is very likely to have an Amp equipped, and the Amp idle, itself not nearly as expressive, overrides the selected school one completely: https://i.imgur.com/MdIWTm8.mp4

In a mission, either with no amp or a scanner equipped, as in the demonstration, the chosen idle is replaced with a generic one: https://i.imgur.com/K49QJSQ.mp4 (Vazarin is equipped, but not playing)

This stands out not only when compared to the Warframes, with their nearly 100(!!) different idle stances complete with different animations for every (ranged) weapon type (except arm cannons but that's fine), but even compared to literal robots. MOAs and Necramechs have different animation sets that affect how they move in missions.

  • Voidrig: https://i.imgur.com/PaigfnW.mp4
  • Bonewidow: https://i.imgur.com/Jfz99qS.mp4
  • MOAs (not my video, I don't have the plat for their sets): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0xy8JEOH6Jo&t=44s
  • The Operator, by comparison: https://i.imgur.com/nB7zFrT.mp4

Even in Captura, when the idles are ostensibly working properly, the different schools lack anything to truly set them apart visually. This isn't really an issue for gameplay, but it does result in every iteration of the Operator- no matter the school, animation, outfit, or amp you've chosen- feeling just about the same to play. Outside of Captura the only thing setting one apart from another is their clothing. To demonstrate, here are clips of each school's moveset (save Unairu, which I have completely neglected <_<):

  • Madurai: https://i.imgur.com/v2EwFNY.mp4
  • Naramon: https://i.imgur.com/HDkyvhR.mp4
  • Unairu, but not really I don't have any of these unlocked: https://i.imgur.com/OE08Ab4.mp4
  • Vazarin: https://i.imgur.com/x0OpuUc.mp4
  • Zenurik: https://i.imgur.com/2TrSeBd.mp4

Instead of being the deeply customizable player avatars they seem meant to be, the lack of differentiation between any set of chosen school, stance, amp, and waybounds in the way they feel to play or even look at makes the Operator- the human heart of the story- feel more robotic than the actual, literal robot companions you can pick up along the way. Making idles work in missions would be one step, adding amp stances for each school would be another. Another still would be differentiating between each school more, but that would require more than 5 new animations and that's a bit much to ask in a feedback thread. It isn't just the idles, either- their faces never move, headtracking is disabled, animations are missing transitions... I went into more detail about the issues in a bug report thread here:

...but the gist of it is, in a game that's otherwise so smooth to play and look at, the Operators feel like planks of wood by comparison to everything else. They need some help, and not all of it should have to wait for The Duviri Paradox, whatever that even is :p

item.title: DE, Please Bring Back Gara removing her Glass after activating Splinter Storm
item.description:
I make this request for three main reasons.

One, just turning off the glass removal has just ruined a big thematic and aesthetic part of Gara for me. I loved how Gara and most of her cosmetics looked when the glass shattered. She still has the cast animation of her 'ripping' her glass off, and yet nothing comes of it. If doing the code for a toggle is too much then just don't do anything! On top of that now I have no idea what Gara Prime looks like without the glass. So many cool aspects of art and animation just lost for... what? People complaining about the Gara Deluxe skin?

The second is because frankly I don't appreciate this 'easy way out' solution you've concocted just to appease a few loud people. You just threw away cool art assets and someone worked on, because some people think the Gara Deluxe skin looks 'ugly' in their opinion without the Glass on. You should've just either A: Addressed it and say you'll do a toggle later, or B: Do a toggle now. I know B is a bit much given Sisters of Parvos and Tennocon coming up but... seriously? This is not a great solution.

Third, I know I'm not alone on this. I've been talking to friends in DM's and in Discord who are also disappointed with this change.

Please just revert this. You wouldn't make Chroma keep his dragon on his body when he activates Effigy, or get rid of all the little bits and parts opening up on Gauss when he uses Redline.

Please and thank you for your time.

item.title: Warframe abilities not being able to interrupt enemy’s movement/animation
item.description:
There is an issue with certain warframes where certain abilities are not strong enough to interrupt enemyâ€™s movement or an animation.

Example 1:

If Ash casts his Smoke Screen near an enemy, then teleports to it straight after it will not open it up for a finisher.

But if I teleport to an enemy then cast Smoke Screen, the stun from smoke screen will override Teleport`s stun animation on the enemy and interrupt it, what does this mean? This means Smoke Screen`s stun has a stronger interruption than teleport.

The same thing goes for when an enemy is climbing over a ledge, if Ash teleports to it the enemy will act like nothing has happened and ignore it,

Itâ€™s like me fly-kicking a Rhino, the Rhino wonâ€™t budge because the impact of my kick isn`t strong enough to stagger it relating it back to Ash, the enemy strait up ignores it but the animation is Ash doing a flip-kick which the enemy should react to the impact does not which makes no sense and is not practical.

Also, Ash teleport has a bug where it can`t consistently open humanoid enemies to finishers (one reason why Ash needs a revisit).

Here is proof.

Example 2:

If an enemy is under a fire or an electric proc and Ash teleports to that enemy it will not open them up for a finisher.

Example 3:

This issue is not exclusive to Ash, other warframes that have to stun enemies to open them up to finishers also experience the same issue.

Wukong`s Cloud Walker

Valkyr`s Paralysis

Lavos` Ophidian Bite

However other warframe don`t have this issue for example.

Excalibur`s Radial Blind

No matter what animation the enemy is in or whatever they are doing, Radial Blind will interrupt them.

Unfortunately, people either don`t know about this or don`t care because all people care about is damage, damage, damage, damage, survivability, strip armour, steel path, damage damage, but I care because I don`t care about the damage meta and I play for fun (in my opinion, the damage meta needs to change but Iâ€™ll already done a post about that so Iâ€™ll leave that alone).

So please DE address this, fixing this will make a big difference.

If you guys want DE to address this issue, please show support by leaving a like and share this post.

item.title: "Show Peculiar Content" Option
item.description:
Note: This is a similar but not identical suggestion to suggestions like this one. Please don't merge our threads.

Normally I'd post something like this around Easter, but the circumstances have changed!

Quote

We like doing seasonal events - in many ways we depend on them. The creative team simply does not want these around all year round. How that fact lands can be turbulent, but that's where they end up every year. Maybe next year, bunny bros.

This is a quote from [DE]Rebecca from the Spring of 2019. Since then, several permanent festive cosmetics have been added to the game which run counter to this statement:

  • Spinneret Ephemera
  • Naberus Ephemera
  • Eros Wings Ephemera - NEW
  • Eros Arrow Skin - Now permanent?

And despite this, DE still does not offer a way for players to hide these or other silly or potentially immersion-breaking cosmetics. Nor do they yet allow some of the other silly cosmetics to be kept permanently. We're stuck in the middle with no solution for any party: people that don't like these cosmetics can't hide them, and people that do like the cosmetics that are still temporary cannot keep them. It's inconsistent and no one is happy with the outcome, including DE's creative team!

Peculiar Content

DE should group these types of cosmetics under the "peculiar" label, which is already used for silly mods like Peculiar Bloom and Peculiar Growth. Peculiar items would be prefixed with a stylized flower icon (, a reference to Peculiar Bloom) to help identify them. This icon would be inserted into text the same way as the Lich icon used for existing Kuva weapon names:

Ephemerals

In addition, the Peculiar Bloom and Peculiar Growth mods are replaced with a new category of Ephemera for weapons, which are given the name "Ephemeral".

  • Ephemeral Bloom
  • Ephemeral Growth

Ephemerals are particle effects or visual changes applied to weapons equipped through the Appearance menu. Other Ephemerals can then be added to the game, like Ephemeral Dex which could change a weapon's muzzle flash or weapon trail to a Lotus symbol like Dex weapons, or Ephemeral Splash which could replace impact effects with the Dog Days water splashes.

Spoiler

Making this change would provide DE with a new set of cosmetics they can sell or add as rewards, while also reworking and improving the existing (and widely unused) Peculiar mods. Weapon Ephemerals can be added to Liches, Queenpins, and other late-game activities, seasonal events, Prime Access, and so on.

"Show Peculiar Content" Option

Accompanying this new Peculiar prefix is a new setting in the Options/Gameplay sub-menu:

The Show Peculiar Content setting has 3 options:

  1. When Appropriate (default)
  2. Always
  3. Never

If this setting is set to When Appropriate, content marked as Peculiar will only be enabled and shown when it is appropriate for them to be visible. If the setting is set to Always or Never, the content is either always or never shown, regardless of when it is appropriate.

Peculiar Content When It Is Appropriate
Norg Mask*, Ephemeral Bloom, Ephemeral Growth Always**
Eros Arrow Skin, Eros Ephemera Around Valentine's Day
Lepus Headgear, Spring Step Ephemera Around Easter
Some new Dog Days cosmetics During the Summer
Dullahan Mask, Naberus Ephemera*, Spinneret Ephemera* Around Halloween
Movember Mustaches During Movember
Ringers Skin, Spearmint Scythe Skin, Festive Glaxion Skin, Little Helper Hat Around Christmas/New Years

* Some content is right on the edge of being too outlandish, and it's up to DE if the want them to be included under this system.
** Some content isn't associated with a specific time of year and would always be appropriate to view, only hidden when Show Peculiar Content is set to Never.

Content that is not appropriate to be seen is not loaded or rendered, and like in the case of skins the default skin is loaded or rendered instead.

Note that this setting would only affect Peculiar content equipped by other players. Peculiar content you equip for yourself would always be shown on your own character.

Additionally, some seasonal cosmetics sets like the Towsun, Day of the Dead, and Solstice sets aren't quite silly enough to be marked Peculiar and would not be affected by this system.

This system can also apply to other types of content as well. For example, DE could add a spooky Nights of Naberus camera effect to missions played on Halloween, and users who have fully opted out would just see a regular mission.

Summary

In this way, silly or otherwise immersion-breaking content can be unified under a single banner. Players that want to avoid this kind of content entirely can do so. Players that want to view this kind of content year-round can do so. Players who do not care either way can continue to experience the same thing they have now. And by recycling the Peculiar name DE can make space for a new set of weapon-based Ephemera to create and sell. Everyone wins!

I sincerely hope that 2021 is the year DE finally sees the light and provides this much-needed option.

item.title: Energy color for vulpaphyla/predasite
item.description:
It bugs me that the energy color for companions can't be customized, especially for vulpaphylas and predasites, since their abilities are very visual.

Panzer vulpaphyla's spores are always orange:

Vizier predasite's spores are always purple, etc:

Doesn't really fit well with my greens.

item.title: Void Relics Segment & Arsenal Loadouts
item.description:
Two suggestions, more so quality of life additions than anything else.

Void Relics Segment

Have you ever went into your void relics segment to check out how close you are to your void trace cap? At the same time, you figured you might as well check if you have a certain relic for whatever reason? Yeah, me too. Every single day I play. Great, how come when you want to make a spreadsheet of your goals and what frames/weapons you want to farm for? I've been there, and I constantly update it, but it's extremely tedious to sometimes have to circle through my void relics segment and then exit out, get into my inventory and check which actual parts I already gathered; extremely frustrating when you have to do that over and over during an assessment.

The suggestion is simple; whenever you hover over a relic and the potential drops show up, let there be an indicator if you already own that piece. Perhaps even a number next to or inside that indicator that shows how many you have of it; would be quite convenient for a lot of us.

Arsenal Loadouts

I might be in the minority with this one, maybe even alone; but I've always wanted to sort out my loadouts based on what type of mission I'm going to. For example, I'd have a loadout called "Defense" and I'd have Frost as a warframe, with weapons and mods dedicated to defending. Now, sticking to the example, we all know there are quite a few frames that suit defense missions; some are even designed with zone control in mind, and I quite frankly don't want to have 5 loadout slots occupied for basically one purpose with many variations.

The suggestion here is simple as well, make config options for loadouts, just like how weapons have them. I don't care if I need to pay extra plat for it, I'm not trying to remove the necessity of acquiring loadout slots, I just think it'd be convenient to have the option to minmax loadouts for different encounters beforehand.

---

The way I play the game and the goals I've set for myself within it dictate that I better be well prepared for any encounter, so I'd like a way to properly be able to prepare with loadout configs; a lot of time and thought would go into it and I believe it would be enjoyable for many people who share the same need for preparation. Now that I think about it more, the void relics UI addition would help during endless void fissure missions as well. I often wonder which relic to pick when I'm merely farming void traces, but knowing what I'm actually missing when I hover over my relics would benefit me tremendously; so please consider.

item.title: About the floaty UI-element over a Kuva Larvling, showing the Lich weapon in advance:
item.description:
I had an idea

I always found it really weird and well... nonsensical to have larvlings show their potential weapon in a FLOATING UI ELEMENT over their heads.
It makes no sense in-universe.

but of course, it's an absolutely necessary feature.

But hear me out:
Why not just equip the Larvlings with base version of the weapon too?
They're already infused with Kuva by being specially chosen grineer, so why not hand them a special grineer weapon too. *cough* Bramma *cough*.

then the floaty UI thing will make sense: because we're just getting a closer look.

This has no farming implications or benefits, a player would see the weapon in a few seconds anyway.
And since NPCs can clearly equip weapons of most classes in Railjack (IDK about melee yet), it shouldn't need more coding for the most part.

Would be really neat to get this with the corpus liches! It was the last Devstream showing the corpus larvling wielding an unrecognizable weapon that gave me this idea.
